item.title: Wednesday’s big stock stories: What’s likely to move the market in the next trading session
item.description: The S&P 500 crept slightly higher on Tuesday, just enough to post another record close. Here's what's on CNBC's radar going into Wednesday.

item.title: Brokerages are likely to slash yields on cash. These firms are still offering solid rates
item.description: Brokerage firms aren't waiting for the Federal Reserve to resume cutting rates. They're already lowering yields paid on your idle cash.

item.title: Alphabet, Amazon are buys ahead of earnings results, portfolio manager says
item.description: Keith Gangl, portfolio manager at Gradient Investments, joined CNBC's "Power Lunch" to offer his takes on the companies.

item.title: The buzz around AI 'neoclouds' is growing, but investors should tread carefully
item.description: "Last year, [neoclouds] were very small, but now it's something that you cannot ignore in terms of size," UBS strategist Sundeep Gantori told CNBC.

item.title: Josh Brown thinks this brokerage stock is going 'way higher'
item.description: Shares of the electronic broker are up more than 40% this year.
